caption: I celebrated my birthday yesterday in this delicious restaurant. Well we enjoyed a great evening and the restaurant was unquestionably the reason for this happy meeting. The stuff  participated in a graceful manner, the cuisine was very good and my friends were so  delighted. We shall surely visit again for more celebrations. thanks very much.
This spot never fails to deliver. They have awesome dishes for fair prices, there are no long waits even when they are packed.
This spot is excellent! Convenient prices, big portions and the employees are always super nice.
This place is worth visiting. They serve large portions for convenient prices. Regularly well organized and with awesome character. Will come visit again.

Average food in small portions. Some tastes good but some is stir fried mushy frozen vegetables. The meat was good but so small in the already small portions. Not that disappointed in the meal but I would probably go somewhere else if I had the choice.
Food is great.  Service is great.  Location is great.  Good option for lunch.

This "food" is garbage. I ordered a lunch combo of fried rice, pad see ew and orange chicken. It all tasted disgusting. The fried rice wasn't real fried rice. I didn't see any egg in it but it also just tasted like there was soy sauce just poured on white rice and some corn and green beans thrown in and that was it. The orange chicken didn't have enough sauce and had a strange taste and the pad see ew also had an odd taste. The price was around $11 and the portion size was tiny. I threw most of it away. I should have listened to prior reviewers. Oh well.

You get very little quantity (rice esp.) for the money you pay. All the curries also tase below avg. This is like a panda express in third world country. I always wondered why there is no line at this place unlike the ones beside this one in merchandize mart. I ate here less than 5 times and I regret it. Avoid this place.

Good orange chicken, terrible prices for what you get. Their lunch Combo A is 1 side, 1 entree for $8.99. Meaning I got a scoop of brown rice in the main styrofoam lunch container with a small scoop of fried chicken in a corner of the container. They charged a flat $10. I would have gotten the steamed veggies as well for another dollar but they were straight from a frozen bag where the carrots are crinkle-cut. This place never has a full line in the food court at Merch Mart like Mezza does right next to Silom. Having a basic cooking background, I can tell when a food court just transfers food from being frozen to something heated up and charges a premium for it.
Last Sunday i was dined out at silom 12 express.Honestly it was very nice place and very big.Everything was so nice and waitresses was also super cool.Thank You!!

I just don't get the other reviews. I've been to Silom 12 a couple dozen times in the last year and the food has always been fresh and flavorful. Their model is typical food court where you simply pick 1, 2, or 3 entres and they assemble it for you in 60 seconds. They have many traditional Thai dishes like massaman, panang, basil, and pad Thai. They also have a couple typical Asian-inspired dishes like orange chicken and egg rolls. My advice is to stick with the Thai food as it has been consistent good for me.
Food too expensive. Taste not that good.
Food was salty and vegetables were bland. Not the worst but far from good.
